intro: Bustillosia chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean bustillosia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Chile. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
